net.semanticmetadata.lire.indexing.fastmap

Class NocacheFastmapDistanceMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.semanticmetadata.lire.indexing.fastmap.NocacheFastmapDistanceMatrix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FastmapDistanceMatrix, DistanceMatrix

    public class NocacheFastmapDistanceMatrix
extends java.lang.Object
implements FastmapDistanceMatrix
    Simulated distance matrix. No internal object is used to create the matrix, but the distance between objects is computed online. Suitable for use with FastMap, but not with HAC, K-Means or alike. Date: 16.09.2008 Time: 12:56:13
    Author:
    Mathias Lux, mathias@juggle.at

    • Constructor Detail

      • NocacheFastmapDistanceMatrix

        public NocacheFastmapDistanceMatrix(java.util.List userObjects,
                            DistanceCalculator distanceFunction)
        Creates a new distance matrix. Please note that the distance matrix uses storage in quadratic size of the user object count. The DistanceCalculator has to be able to work on those userObjects.
        Parameters:
        userObjects - gives the collection of object to be processed
        distanceFunction - allows the distance calculation or -1 if objects distance cannot be computes, has to be a metric

      • NocacheFastmapDistanceMatrix

        public NocacheFastmapDistanceMatrix(java.util.List userObjects,
                            DistanceCalculator distanceFunction,
                            boolean distributeObjects)
        Creates a new distance matrix. Please note that the distance matrix uses storage in quadratic size of the user object count. The DistanceCalculator has to be able to work on those userObjects.
        Parameters:
        userObjects - gives the collection of object to be processed
        distanceFunction - allows the distance calculation or -1 if objects distance cannot be computes, has to be a metric
        userObjects - select true if you want to distribute not equal but zero distance objects.

    • Method Detail

      • getDistance

        public double getDistance(java.lang.Object o1,
                 java.lang.Object o2)
        Calculates the distance between objects using the distance function for k = 0, using DistanceCalculator.getDistance(Object, Object). If it has not been computed previously it is computed and stored now.
        Specified by:
        getDistance in interface DistanceMatrix
        Parameters:
        o1 - Object 1 to compute
        o2 - Object 2 to compute
        Returns:
        the distance as float from [0, infinite)

      • getDistance

        public double getDistance(int index1,
                 int index2)
        Calculates the distance between objects using the distance function for k = 0, using DistanceCalculator.getDistance(Object, Object). If it has not been computed previously it is computed and stored now.
        Specified by:
        getDistance in interface DistanceMatrix
        Parameters:
        index1 - index of first object to compute
        index2 - index of second object to compute
        Returns:
        the distance as float from [0, infinite)

      • getDistance

        public double getDistance(int index1,
                 int index2,
                 int k,
                 double[] x1,
                 double[] x2)
        Calculates and returns the distance between two objects. Please note that the distance function has to be symmetric and must obey the triangle inequality. distance in k is: d[k+1](o1,o2)^2 = d[k](o1,o2)^2 - (x1[k]-x2[k])^2 .
        Specified by:
        getDistance in interface FastmapDistanceMatrix
        Parameters:
        index1 - index of first object to compute
        index2 - index of second object to compute
        k - defines the dimension of current fastmap operation
        x1 - is needed when k > 0 (see documentation above), all x1[l] with l < k have to be present.
        x2 - is needed when k > 0 (see documentation above), all x2[l] with l < k have to be present.
        Returns:
        the distance as float from [0, infinite)

      • getMaximumDistance

        public int getMaximumDistance(int row,
                     int k,
                     double[][] points)
        Used for the heuristic for getting the pivots as described in the paper.
        Specified by:
        getMaximumDistance in interface FastmapDistanceMatrix
        Parameters:
        row - defines the row where we want to find the maximum
        k - defines the dimension of current fastmap operation
        points - is needed when k > 0 (see documentation above), all x1[l] with l < k have to be present.
        Returns:
        the index of the object with maximum distance to the row object.

      • getMaximumDistance

        public int getMaximumDistance(int row)
        Used for the heuristic for getting the pivots as described in the paper. This method calls FastmapDistanceMatrix.getMaximumDistance(int, int, double[][]) with parameters (row, 0, null, null).
        Specified by:
        getMaximumDistance in interface DistanceMatrix
        Parameters:
        row - defines the row where we want to find the maximum
        Returns:
        the index of the object with maximum distance to the row object.
        See Also:
        FastmapDistanceMatrix.getMaximumDistance(int, int, double[][])
